Pakpao kites have their origins in Thailand's Sukhothai and Rattanakosin periods, where kite flying was not only a favored pastime but also a sport enjoyed by royalty and nobles. During these eras, kite flying competitions were hosted in royal courts, highlighting the grace and expertise required to skillfully maneuver the kites.

Pakpao kites date back to the Sukhothai and Rattanakosin periods in Thailand, where kite flying was not only a popular pastime but also a royal sport enjoyed by kings and nobles.
